commentary: Eridan essentially kills other kids' parents, making him an "orphaner," just like his ancestor. As for the Caligula part of his handle, well, it's not hard to see a tyrannical, asshole emperor, known for his cruelty and perversity, as a historical blueprint for Eridan (who, if he doesn't quite live up to that image, certainly would like to). There's a little more going on here, though. "Caligula" shares the same root as "caliginous," which is a word for darkness and a part of troll romance lexicon associated with blackrom. Eridan, a "hopeless romantic," is particularly fixated on filling his black quadrant.
